results.title: Case of the hidden factor
results.creator_credit: Gil Brealey, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Stanley Dalby
results.brief_description: Discusses the scope for improvement of storage and handling methods in industry, showing examples of good and poor practice, and the work of the National Materials Handling Bureau in the field.

results.title: Carved in ivory
results.creator_credit: Concord Films, Arts Council of Great Britain and Michael Gill
results.brief_description: Examines small ivory sculptures created by anonymous masters from 700-1200 A.D. Much of their work decorates devotional objects such as croziers, crosses and caskets and their themes are mainly religious. Includes carvings from collections in Brunswick, Brussels, Copenhagen, Munich, Paris and New York besides a number from the Victoria and Albert and other museums in Britain. Describes these art objects in their historical and artistic context. Narrated by Sir Kenneth Clark.

results.title: Carve her name with pride [study extract]
results.creator_credit: Rank Organisation Film Productions, Society for Education in Film and Television, Daniel M. Angel and Lewis Gilbert
results.brief_description: An extract from “Carve her name with pride”. Tells the story of Violette Szabo, the British secret agent, who undertook various missions in Occupied France during the Second World War, until she was captured and finally shot in Germany. Cast: Violette Szabo - Virginia McKenna Jacques - Maurice Ronet Interrogator - Noel Willman

results.title: Carthage rediscovered
results.brief_description: Carthage was once a maritime city open to the whole of the ancient world, today it is a suburb of Tunis but one has only to dig beneath the asphalt of any part of modern Carthage, to find extensive remains of the ancient city. Several missions are today making excavations in various areas in the hope of saving the stones and the mosaics.

results.title: Carrot nose
results.brief_description: Animated puppets are used to tell a story about some children who visit their grandmother at the farm where they build a snow man whose carrot nose is stolen by rabbits who need food in the wintertime.

results.title: Carronbank: Deaf Blind Education
results.creator_credit: Francis Treacey, Victoria College (Melbourne, Vic.) and Des Pickering
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Victoria College Special Education Films”.
A documentary that looks at the education of children with visual and hearing impairment. A very important early stage of education is to teach the children how to communicate and the teachers at Carronbank discuss how this is done. The curriculums, at Carronbank, cater for all needs, including social skills as well as the educational requirements.

results.title: Carrie (Special edition) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Paul Monash, United Artists Corporation and Brian De Palma
results.brief_description: Based upon the novel by Stephen King, this film is the story of a young girl who is ostracized at school because of her ‘weird’ mother and upbringing. At the onset of puberty, Carrie White (played eerily by Sissy Spacek) discovers that she has special telekinetic powers that seem to become stronger when she is angered. She is finally pushed into a no return path of bloody vengeance on her cruel classmates. Piper Laurie contributes a memorable performance as the deranged Mrs. White, Carrie’s mother. Directed by a master of suspense and in the vein of Alfred Hitchcock, this film is an excellent example of tense and stylish horror. Cast also includes John Travolta, Amy Irving and Nancy Allen.

results.title: Carpets in Bri-nylon X-21
results.creator_credit: Leon Clore, Basic Films, British Nylon Spinners and J.B. Napier-Bell
results.brief_description: The introduction of new methods and materials is revolutionizing the British carpet industry. One of the most important of these developments lies in the use of Bri-nylon X-21, a continuous filament bulked nylon yarn, on new tufting machinery to produce an article quite different from the traditional woven carpet. Describes the manufacture of these carpets and emphasises their hard wearing qualities and the ease with which they can be cleaned.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Leon Clore, Basic Films, British Nylon Spinners and J.B. Napier-Bell
